content.description: The line about 1/2 way between the start of Hades and the scramble corner up to the top of the Cathonian slab and Atlantis
content.protection: Might get something in, usually TR-ed with either a directional or anchor on the wall behind.

content.description: Another easy runout slab route to the Inferno ledge. Climb up on easy holds to a bolt at half way, clip the bolt and run it out on 5.6 slab with good texture to the ledge. Belay from trees.
content.protection: Besides the one bolt at half way there's almost nothing good for pro, be solid at the grade.
content.location: Moving right from the Cross Walk / Criss Cross area, there is about a 50 ft section of heavy, dark lichen.  This climb starts about 50-60 ft right of Cross Walk and, as of summer 2020, is the first "clean" climb you come to. Huge 18-inch diameter maple just on the other side of the path along the base, another 10-inch maple grows right at the base. R Hall NH Admin 2020

content.description:
[NOTE: Very possibly the same climb as "Underworld", the description sure sounds like it.  If you've ever led the climb with a "bolt at 20ft"....and "You WILL NOT want to fall at the top", well...you'll sort of rememnber it. R Hall NH Admin. ] 

 Climb up 15' place the cam and nut, step up and clip the bolt at 20'. Make the crux move (well protected) and move up another 20' to the top. You WILL NOT want to fall from the top! Not recomended from someone leading .7 as their limit. The Webster book has this climb at 5.6x, but the bolt was added later and I guess maybe you won't hit the ground and I felt the moves were harder than .6. Of course maybe I was just scared.
content.protection: purple tcu, medium nut and a draw.
content.location: Directly under the bottom of the Inferno arch there is a beautiful white streak with good holds, 50' to the right of the common hotter than hell start.

content.description:
Not much of a route on it's own, but good if you want an extra pitch of climbing to gain the start ledge of Inferno.

 Start about 25 ft right of Underworld, near the right end of the slab behind a tree and climb towards a single bolt. A few small horizontals offer pro. Clip the bolt and finish up the slab to the right of the big block (watch for loose rock). Belay from trees.
content.protection: Small cams or tricams for the horizontals and a single bolt.
content.location: The rightmost of the routes on the lower slab below Inferno. Easily identified by the single bolt and the big block at the top.

climbs.name: Crosswalk
climbs.fa: FA Uwe Schnieder, Chris Stevens, and Brian Tessier 5/92

content.description: Starts about 15 ft right of brimstone where obvious cracks slant up rightward.. Look for a new bolt towards the top. (Hard to see from base)  A little bit harder than its neighbor but super fun. Well protected face climbing with some fun sequences. A little dirty but worth it.
content.protection: One bolt near the top.  Single rack to 1

content.description: START a few feet right of Cross Walk where to thin cracks meet in a sort of "A" formation and cross.  This climb is much less climbed than any of the other climbs on the slab. Bring a wire brush. Start behind the trees and climb thru the cracks to the face above.
content.protection: Thin stuff.  Best to TR this one

climbs.name: Brimstone
climbs.fa: Uwe Schneider, Chris Stevens, Brian Tessier April 1992

content.description: A nice warm up for the routes near Hotter Than Hell. Head up blocky slab to cracks/gear, continue up the face passing a bolt to tree ledge by HTH's start.
content.protection: small cams or wires, 1 bolt (see comment), tree anchorCOMMENT ("Bruce Bruce"): Good pro, especially with small cams. Bomber #3 first piece. For TR you can use cams to back up the dubious looking dead tree in a low horizontal crack back left.
content.location: Furthest left climb on the slab. When approach trail meets cliff, head left a bit to a worn area at the base of a slab with 2 bolted climbs. Brimstone is the left climb and Crosswalk 5.7+ is the right one. Continuing right on the trail below the slab brings you to the 4th class approach to HTH

content.description:
The slab that resides immediately below the starts of climbs such as Hotter Than Hell, Tranquility and Atlantis.

 At least five, short ( 50 ft, or so) climbs, fairly easily toproped, the furthest left climb (Brimstone) is frequently used as a first pitch to Hotter Than Hell.
